Articles.Content:
Hello, I've recently noticed the appearance of the message "Chutter reset: complete" during flight.

I haven't noticed before specially on vanilla KSP. Is it a MOD that shows it? What does it mean?

Edited October 24, 2014 by jlcarneiro

Hello, I've recently noticed the appearance of the message "Chutter reset: complete" during flight.

I haven't noticed before specially on vanilla KSP. Is it a MOD that shows it? What does it mean?

Are you sure it didn't say clutter?
Not sure. I googled 'chutter' but the results were not encouraging

If you are saying the message shows up on your flight screen (and not in the log) that sounds like it might be my mod. If you downloaded my chute quickload fixer (called ChuteQuickloadFixer.dll), it displays a message to the screen when it has finished. "Chute Reset : Complete"

(This one: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-0-25-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules)

Hmm. Maybe I'll remove that in the next release. I didn't think about it causing confusion.

Cheers,

Edited October 24, 2014 by Claw

Not sure. I googled 'chutter' but the results were not encouraging

Seems to me that a "chutter reset mechanism" would be an appropriate feature for Kerbal rockets.

Seems to me that a "chutter reset mechanism" would be an appropriate feature for Kerbal rockets.

HEHEHEHE! My mistake, I should have typed "chute" like Claw identified! Sorry... But this was funny!

If you are saying the message shows up on your flight screen (and not in the log) that sounds like it might be my mod. If you downloaded my chute quickload fixer (called ChuteQuickloadFixer.dll), it displays a message to the screen when it has finished. "Chute Reset : Complete"

(This one: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-0-25-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules)

Hmm. Maybe I'll remove that in the next release. I didn't think about it causing confusion.

Cheers,

Thanks! I indeed have just installed your fixes (mainly because of the "kerbal ejection") and didn't remember. Thanks for you response... And for your fixes, of course!
